title: US Treasury Repeals DeFi Broker Tax Rule
summary: The US Treasury and IRS have formally repealed the controversial 'crypto broker' tax rule that would have required DeFi platforms and non-custodial services to report detailed customer transaction data. The rule was overturned by Congress in March and signed by President Trump in April, with Treasury confirming in July 2025 that it has no legal force.

title: CZ Threatens Legal Action Against Bloomberg
summary: Former Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao (CZ) has threatened to sue Bloomberg over a report concerning Trump and stablecoins, highlighting ongoing tensions between crypto executives and media coverage.

title: Grayscale Presses SEC on Multi-Crypto Fund Launch
summary: Grayscale is urging the SEC to approve its multi-crypto fund launch, citing potential investor harm from regulatory delays in bringing diversified crypto investment products to market.

title: Senator Warren Unveils Crypto Standards, Criticizes GOP
summary: Senator Elizabeth Warren has unveiled new crypto standards while criticizing GOP policies as a 'handout' to the industry, continuing her stance as a prominent crypto skeptic in Congress.

title: US Congress to Discuss Crypto Tax Policy
summary: US lawmakers are set to discuss crypto tax policy amid efforts to pass three bills, signaling potential changes to how digital assets are taxed at the federal level.

title: Florida AG Investigates Robinhood Crypto
summary: Florida's Attorney General is investigating Robinhood Crypto for allegedly misleading users about trading costs, potentially impacting the platform's operations in the state.

title: Former Blockchain Executive Confirmed to Lead OCC
summary: The Senate has confirmed Jonathan Gould, a former blockchain executive, to lead the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC), potentially signaling a more crypto-friendly approach to banking regulation.

title: Coinbase Sues Oregon Governor Over Crypto Policy
summary: Coinbase has filed a lawsuit against Oregon Governor Kotek for public records related to a crypto policy shift, amid charges brought against the firm by the state.

title: Russia Launches Crypto Mining Equipment Registry
summary: Russia has rolled out a crypto mining equipment registry, marking a significant step in regulating the country's growing mining industry.

title: Dubai Approves First Tokenized Money Market Fund
summary: Dubai has approved its first tokenized money market fund as part of its drive to become a hub for real-world asset (RWA) tokenization in the Middle East.

title: Hong Kong Plans Stablecoin Licenses This Year
summary: Hong Kong is planning to issue stablecoin licenses this year, though approvals are expected to remain in single digits as regulators take a cautious approach.

title: South Korea to Lift Crypto Venture Restrictions
summary: South Korea plans to lift restrictions on crypto venture businesses, potentially opening new opportunities for blockchain startups in the country.

title: Pakistan Launches Crypto Regulatory Body
summary: Pakistan has established a crypto regulatory body to oversee the digital asset sector, marking the country's formal entry into crypto regulation.

title: Australia Central Bank Tests CBDCs and Tokenized Assets
summary: Australia's central bank is advancing Project Acacia to test CBDCs and tokenized asset settlement, exploring the potential for digital currency in wholesale markets.

title: New Zealand to Ban Crypto ATMs
summary: New Zealand will ban crypto ATMs in efforts to combat money laundering, following similar moves by other countries concerned about illicit use of crypto infrastructure.

title: Shenzhen Warns Against Stablecoin Fundraising Scams
summary: The Shenzhen government has issued warnings about stablecoin scams and illegal crypto fundraising, highlighting continued regulatory concerns in China despite the crypto ban.

title: SEC Commissioner Warns on Tokenized Securities Compliance
summary: SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce warned that tokenized stocks remain securities requiring full federal compliance, as firms like Coinbase and Kraken explore launching tokenized equities. Despite blockchain innovation potential, the SEC will enforce strict disclosure requirements and oversight.
